intro: Ceropegia dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in umbels, which are attractive to specific pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening.
